ol.li: Close the Hawkes software.
From the Windows Start menu, browse to All Programs -> Hawkes Learning Systems -> Software Title -> Help -> Reregister DLLs.
Click Next.
Select the option "Unregister, then register files (Troubleshooting)".
Click Next, Next, and Finish.
From the Windows Start menu, browse to All Programs -> Hawkes Learning Systems -> Software Title -> Advanced Configuration.
At the warning prompt, click Yes.
Click on the "Startup" option on the left sidebar.
Select the “Enable DLL Registration” option.
Select the “Register DLLs per user” option.
Click Save, then Close. If prompted, update the master copy as well.
When you open the Hawkes software again, the DLLs will be initialized before you are prompted to enter your Access Code
Once the DLLs are successfully registered, you can repeat steps 1-6 to speed up the startup performance of the software.
Download the uninstaller for Flash Player here and save it to your Desktop.
Exit all browsers and other programs that use Flash.
Run the uninstaller by double-clicking on the icon that was saved in Step 1 and follow the prompts.

Verify that the uninstallation is complete by restarting your computer and going to the About Adobe Flash Player page. If this page has either a question mark, an empty box, or a message "Adobe Flash Player cannot be found", then the uninstallation is complete.
Open Internet Explorer, and go to  http://get.adobe.com/flashplayer/. (This must be done from Internet Explorer; not Safari, Firefox, Google Chrome, etc.)
Uncheck the box next to "Yes, install Google Toolbar - optional".
Click the "Download Now" button.
When the file download dialog box appears, please click Run.
When the security warning dialog box appears, please click Run.
When the user account control dialog box appears, please click Continue or Yes.
Click "Finish" when the installer has completed.
To verify that Flash was installed properly, open Internet Explorer and go to the About Adobe Flash Player page. If the flash video plays properly, then the reinstall was successful.
Close the Hawkes software.
From the Windows Start menu, please select Documents or My Documents.

li.mainStep: If there is a "Hawkes Learning Systems" folder, continue to next step. If this folder does not exist, CLICK HERE.

At the warning prompt, click Yes.
Click on the "Startup" option on the left sidebar.
In the main panel, take note of the file path on line #6, "User Directory". This is the your user directory.
Go to the Windows Start menu and click "Computer" (or "My Computer").
Navigate to your User Directory by opening the appropriate folders in the file path from step

Open the Software Title folder.
